sentence.text: But if these were all roles he played , they were necessary ones ; they protected a man who could be extremely shy and nervous in the company of other people .
Harbour was extremely nervous , this being his first professional engagement , and equally determined to seize his chance .
Insurers are more nervous about Ariane because if something goes wrong the whole rocket is likely to blow up , destroying everything on board .
` I 'm more nervous than you are , Bob .
` I was really nervous because I 'd never kissed anybody and she was really nice .
She was really nervous when the police came . "
She smiled slightly , a nervous smile that held kindliness .
Callum gave a slightly nervous laugh and glanced towards Robyn .
` I was so nervous and fatigued that I could n't concentrate .
I was physically ill the day before I met her because I was so nervous !
She always did this when other people were listening ; it was as if she was too nervous to discuss it with him face to face .
I was too inexperienced and nervous to understand the obviousness of his approach .
But the schoolmaster 's tone was a little too nervous , his words too rushed to hide his anxiety .
I was always very nervous when trying to help a very dear elderly aunt , because I never did things quite the ` right " way !
Gatsby is very nervous , as he has n't seen Daisy for many years and if she no longer loves him his whole purpose for living has gone .
If he becomes nervous about eating , it will make his physical difficulties worse .
He knew that she became nervous when she invited people round , fussing over minor details , and that she was offering to visit him through a sense of duty .
` I felt less nervous in the play-off against Faldo than I have here .
You see , what I did n't know , is that she was feeling terribly nervous as well , just as I was .
You rang me , " Sly replied , suddenly feeling nervous .
Hannah felt very nervous and almost trembly at that moment .
But Mrs Snell got so nervous about everything .
I began to get nervous when these new fluorescent vehicles started being referred to as ` mountain' bikes .
This is where I get nervous because I know I 've come into a word I know I ca n't pronounce .
I shot a nervous glance at our host .
Sweeping a nervous glance around the dark garden , Loretta joined them in Puddephat 's sitting-room .
She was a shy , quiet woman in her mid-twenties with a tinkling nervous laugh .
The humour was heavy-handed and , in response to Simon Franks ' nervous laugh , Blanche smiled politely .
Do n't believe everything you 've heard about us , " she hastened to add with a nervous smile .
He turned to David with a nervous smile .
` Well , sir ? " he asked Sharpe , but in a nervous voice which suggested that he expected his temerity in asking to be met with a savage reproof .
A nervous voice barked at her to go to a small van parked outside her house .
But they are also nervous that Microsoft 's applications group -- responsible for OLE 2.0 -- has had the specification , and code , since 1991 .
He 's such a huge star now that I was actually nervous when I walked into the studio with him . "
Indeed , he was nervous when I was out of the attic .
It makes me nervous when you keep dipping unexpectedly like that . "
She was nervous about her plan now .
Fleischmann said that one of the referees had said that it was nonsense and that the reaction of this referee had made him nervous about the validity of their experiment .
Is he nervous about the critical reaction to his first work of fiction ?
He 'd sounded nervous on the phone last night .
You may find that older dogs are nervous under these circumstances , if they have never been on a train or bus before , and you should always try to reassure them with your tone of voice .
Neville 's nervous tic accelerated slightly , but he fixed the boy with a piercing gaze of the type favoured by cobras whilst surveying their four-footed lunch .
` The captain is a little nervous , I think , " he said .
As as students in a lecture you can tell when a lecturer is nervous .
He seemed totally relaxed , but Polly was suddenly as nervous as a kitten .
